data.title: Seperator Replacement
Fixed Windows Installer Version Number
data.body: We now pull the Windows installer version number from the TeamCity environment variable.  This ensures we can update the build version from TeamCity and have the build reflect that change.

data.title: Replaced sdl1.2 with opentk for gamepad and joystick
data.body: I replaced all the sdl 1.2 code with opentk equivalent for joystick and gamepad, tho there is no way to get joystick name using opentk AFAIK. This PR should probably get tested a bit before merging.

data.title: Gtk Pipeline fix for 3122
data.body: fix for #3122

data.title: MonoGame.Portable returns - now with Piranah's
data.body:
Right, so I've been working with @dellis1972 on the PCL generator project and it looks like it is close to being done.
It now uses a PCL generator solution based on Mono.Cecil called Piranah (which Dean has also updated to run on a Mac)
Generator branch for MG can be found here: https://github.com/DDReaper/MonoGame/tree/PiranahPCLGenerator

The generator only uses the WindowsGL build as a template, which seems sufficient for the PCL to be used in a "Bait and Switch" style PCL as a core platform.  Platform specific code should always remain in a Platform project (like iOS), where as all common "core" code should be used in the PCL.

Question is now how to provide this framework back in to the MonoGame project so it can be run in an automated fashion.  In the branch above (using Protobuild as a template) I've created a new ThirdParty folder for Piranah and put the runtime exe and Dll's in there.
There is a commandline file to generate the project manually for test at the moment (need both the WindowsGL project built and an output folder in MonoGame.Framework/bin/PCL created first)

I've also started on a new MonoGame.Portable NuGet package, which is still a work in progress.  In testing it needs more platform targets to work effectively.

So next steps?

data.title: Importing XML through the MGCB processor - errors
data.body:
From one fire to the next.  I'm converting an old XNA 4 project to MonoGame and running in to issues with the XML importer.  

SO far I have two issues (which were not an issue in the original XNA XML content importer.

1: "Not have enough entries in space-separated list!"
this seems related to how certain data types are imported, e.g. A vector 2 is expected to be 2 integers space separated.
The source XML hasn't changed but with the MGCB processor it is  falling over.

2: The Xml element `<item>` is required!
Although this imported fine in XNA, which ignored missing values.  With the MGCB importer, it seems to be forcing the XML de-serialisation to make all fields mandatory

Any ideas on these.  I would rather not have to go and edit the hundreds of XML configuration files used in this project, especially since they worked fine previously.

data.title: Content builder - Handling custom data types
data.body:
Is it possible to handle custom data types in a mgcb importer?

In XNA days we could have a separate class project with custom types defined and then reference that to the content solution.

data.title: Fix intermittent VertexBuffer.GetData bug when vertexStride != sizeof(T)
data.body:
and remove unused DataPointer variable.

This bug has been present since at least February 2014, but I suspect it wasn't noticed because not many people, if any, used the overload of `GetData` that specifies a `vertexStride`.

The tests I added recently exercised this code path, and caused the loop to overrun the buffer, but it was intermittent, depending on what happened to be in the memory following the buffer.

data.title: Curve improvements
data.body: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3395

data.title: Content Pipeline always rebuilds TextureFonts if firstcharacter is set to " "
data.body:
This seems to be due to an issue with Xml Deserialization of the string, as a matter of fact it fails the check in 
AreParametersEqual(cachedEvent.Parameters, Parameters)
because 
cachedEvent.Parameters["FirstCharacter"] = ""
and
Parameters["FirstCharacter"] = " "

data.title: Windows Pipeline "Content reader could not be found" in Reflective Reader on Array of content.
data.body:
"Content reader could not be found for System.Int32 type." when i try to load a custom processed array of items. It seems like the Pipeline associates 2 types of readers, the first one is correct while the second one is a Reflective Reader whose initializator throws complaining it cant find the System.Int32 reader to read a field of my object. I don't know yet if this happens on single content types.
By modifying the pipeline to catch the error i can go past the error and the elements get loaded just fine.

data.title: ContentPipeline Crashes if it cannot find the default PipelineProcessor for an Importer on Windows
data.body: ContentPipeline crashes if it cannot find the default PipelineProcessor for an Importer, this is a reproducible issue, in any custom content project simply change a letter of the PipelineProcessor in the ContentImporter attribute to trigger a crash whenever you choose the Importer from the dropdown of an item.

data.title: Windows branch
Remove Old Content Addin for XS from the Build process.
data.body:
This is an old addin that is no longer needed now the Pipeline tool is cross platform. 
For now we just remove the calls from the nant script. 
The PR covering the new addin will remove this entirely.

data.title: Xam.iOS Unified: small fixes so that MG builds
data.body:
- Texture2D.OpenGL : Making sure we don't cast vars to ints prematurely. CGBitmapContext constructor is expecting nints and although I think this conversion should be occurring implicitly, it appears that one runs into issues if we cast and then pass width/height vars as ints.
- KeyboardInputView: UILabel.StringSize was deprecated and is removed in unified API, so need an alternate approach
- SignedInGamer: Conversion from DateTime to NSDate needs to be explicit. A suggested solution in http://developer.xamarin.com/guides/cross-platform/macios/unified/ is to add extension methods which have been included, but people may prefer for them to be located somewhere else.

data.title: Remove old MonoGame.ContentPipeline
data.body:
With the new content pipeline in place it is finally time to kill off the old XNA MonoGame processors.

Everything in the folder...

  https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/tree/develop/MonoGame.ContentPipeline

... can be deleted.  

We also need to fix the build script to stop building it and the Windows installer to skip installing it.

data.title: TypeDescriptor.AddAttributes() with TypeConverterAttribute not working in content importer
data.body:
Something I've done for quite some time in my game is use TypeDescriptor.AddAttributes() to specify type converters for common types like Vector2 and Rectangle so they're serialized and deserialized as a comma-delimited string.

When trying to use this same strategy in a content importer with MGCB, it fails to make any change to the converter returned with TypeDescriptor.GetConverter(). I'm mystified as to what could be causing this behavior.

Example:

``` C#
TypeDescriptor.AddAttributes(typeof(Rectangle), new TypeConverterAttribute(typeof(RectangleConverter)));
TypeConverter converter = TypeDescriptor.GetConverter(typeof(Rectangle));
```

The converter variable is the default TypeConverter instead of a RectangleConverter as it should be. At first I thought it was some oddity with JSON.NET but having the following GetConverter() call not return the proper type seems to indicate otherwise.

data.title: Viewport and WindowClientSizeChanged Bug call in Mg OpenGL
data.body:
ok i was testing fullscreen mode switching under ogl and other little windowed fs switches
which works for the most part,  but still fails overall

i seem to have found a strange bug were the windows client size change event is firing twice sometimes i.e. calling its event method twice which is in my case the OnResize() method
when this happens its not really a big deal but... i suppose it could be
also worse for some reason it appears on a couple modes and these are fairly safe modes 
the viewport is not being changed this leaves a fullscreen mode that looks pretty terrible

the test Code
https://onedrive.live.com/?cid=BEE9E3EE9236C993&id=BEE9E3EE9236C993!267
basically just make a mg project and replace the game1 class with this 
set the project properties were it says application change that to console
run it youll get a console and game window you may want to edit the consoles buffer to have a larger height like 500 or 600 ... it runs a auto test then 
after which it will let you do all the individual test with the F1 thru 12 keys
this is basically a test that tells you what is changing and the order of things that occured

below is the relevant  output snippet from my algorithmic test 
it is between two mode switches in fullscreen basically a next mode function
the second user F9 mode switch did not work properly leaving a portion of the desktop visible

the output shows what changed differently from the first mode switch that did work
to the second that did not
it appears the viewport and viewport tilesafe area didn't change in the second test
to boot although the first worked you can see the OnResize() was called twice internally

---

INPUT  F9   attempting next displaymode

```
Code   :relevant:
gdm.PreferredBackBufferWidth = dm.Width;
gdm.PreferredBackBufferHeight = dm.Height;
gdm.PreferredBackBufferFormat = dm.Format;
gd.PresentationParameters.BackBufferWidth = dm.Width;
gd.PresentationParameters.BackBufferHeight = dm.Height;
gd.PresentationParameters.BackBufferFormat = dm.Format;
gdm.IsFullScreen = true; // call this specifically here as this might fail windowed
```

 Next Display mode coaxing setting fullscreen
 Ensureing we are in fullscreen [code] gdm.IsFullScreen = true;

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

   diff gdm.FullScreen CHANGE FROM False TO True
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.IsFullScreen CHANGE FROM False TO True

---

 gd.displaymode values now ... wh 1024,768 aspct 1.333333 format Color
 attempt to switch to the next displaymode[3] from 2
 next displaymode wh 1152,864 sf Color aspectratio 1.333333
 ChangeToNextDisplayMode... ends

  User or Script calling My ApplyTheChanges() which will make the call
  Before gdm.ApplyingChanges

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

   diff gdm.PreferredBackBuffer(Width Height) CHANGE FROM {X:1024 Y:768} TO {X:1152 Y:864}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.Bounds CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.BackBuffer(WidthHeight) CHANGE FROM {X:1148 Y:838} TO {X:1152 Y:864}
   diff gd.DisplayMode.(Width, Height) CHANGE FROM {X:1024 Y:768} TO {X:1152 Y:864}
   diff gd.DisplayMode.TitleSafeArea CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1024 Height:768} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}
   diff gd.Adapter.CurrentDisplayMode.WH CHANGE FROM {X:1024 Y:768} TO {X:1152 Y:864}
   diff gd.Adapter.CurrentDisplayMode.TitleSafeArea CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1024 Height:768} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}

---

  Now we will call...  gdm.ApplyChanges()...
  After  gdm.ApplyingChanges was called ... OnResize was NOT Yet called

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

---

   ...leaving my ApplyTheChanges method

  "A Resize Has Just Occured"  Window.ClientSizeChanged has fired...OnResize
  Within OnResize.... my ApplyTheChanges() Was NOT called

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

   diff gd.PresentationParameters.Bounds CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.BackBuffer(WidthHeight) CHANGE FROM {X:1152 Y:864} TO {X:1148 Y:838}

---

  "A Resize Has Just Occured"  Window.ClientSizeChanged has fired...OnResize
  Within OnResize.... my ApplyTheChanges() Was NOT called

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

   diff Window.ClientBounds CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.Bounds CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.BackBuffer(WidthHeight) CHANGE FROM {X:1148 Y:838} TO {X:1152 Y:864}
   diff gd.Viewport CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838 MinDepth:0 MaxDepth:1} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864 MinDepth:0 MaxDepth:1}
   diff gd.Viewport.TitleSafeArea CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1148 Height:838} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864}

---

 !!! Note !!! OnResize was fired more then once... this would only be normal if applychanges was called more then once

---

INPUT  F9   attempting next displaymode

```
Code   :relevant:

```

   ------ changes that occured -----------

---

---

   diff gd.PresentationParameters.Bounds CHANGE FROM {X:0 Y:0 Width:1152 Height:864} TO {X:0 Y:0 Width:1280 Height:960}
   diff gd.PresentationParameters.BackBuffer(WidthHeight) CHANGE FROM {X:1152 Y:864} TO {X:1280 Y:960}

data.title: Texture parameters on effects can now be explicitly set to null
data.body:
Fixes #3351.

Please feel free to review this thoroughly before merging :) I haven't changed many lines of code in `EffectPass`, but it's quite a fundamental change. I hope I've understood the `_stateKey` system correctly - I based it on how `ConstantBuffer.Update` works.

data.title: Pipeline indicator for missing files
data.body: I liked the idea from #3322 so I added it.

data.title: need simpler fully functional Installation
data.body:
it would be nice if there was a quick download that included the pipeline tool
the 3.2 official download doesn't have it, nor do the dev or nightly builds include it
that's fine if you dont want to use fx files or models but most people do

so then the zip download for the source has the folder. but...
when you dl it, then run protobuild... you get solutions   but .... vs wont compile it
it will give tons of errors instead, im guessing this is because dependancy's are missing
but you find that out after the fact with no instructions or warning

if a new guy feels corralled into using github 
because of constantly failing to get monogame working,  then he must now
learn how to use github and git... before ... installing monogme
the problem with this is he is probably new or solo (xna was for indies) 
additionally he isn't clicking something called
"learn how to use git so you can learn how to install monogame"

basically unlike xna, 
this amounts to jumping thru hoops non stop to load fx files or a model
worse finding the particular instructions is horrible because 
there are so many on the net and here, most are incomplete (missing steps) confusing (leave out requisite steps) or worse simply don't apply or work

most people will simply just give up long before this and go download unity or something else
seriously nothing is worse 
then downloading something that you need to sift thru a unorganized confusing 10 page 
installation instruction manual just to get it to fully install
it makes it very hard to recommend monogame to anyone who wants to do 3d stuff
when you have to tell them there is a bunch of stuff you have to read to install it

so again point is... it would be nice if there was a install download that included the pipeline tool

data.title: Xamarin iOS Unified API
data.body: This is a working pull request for the Xamarin iOS Unified API (https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/3139), as the old pull request was messed up with wrong files.

data.title: Linux: mouse coordinates based on screen, not window
data.body:
Using the sample program that @thefiddler posted in #2464 with development tip (commit 492439c5).

I see that monogame is producing coordinates with the origin at the top left of the _screen_ rather than the top left of the _window_. For instance, when I put the cursor at the top left of the window, when the window is on the lower half of my right monitor, I expect it to print mouse coordinates "0, 0" but instead it prints "1975, 760".
